results.definition: the act of brushing your teeth
examples: the dentist recommended two brushes a day

results.definition: the act of brushing your hair
examples: he gave his hair a quick brush
Her long skirt brushed the floor

results.definition: a bushy tail or part of a bushy tail (especially of the fox)
an implement that has hairs or bristles firmly set into a handle

examples: She brushed the suit before hanging it back into the closet

results.definition: conducts current between rotating and stationary parts of a generator or motor
contact with something dangerous or undesirable
examples: I had a brush with danger on my way to work
he tried to avoid any brushes with the police
brush the bread with melted butter

results.definition: remove with or as if with a brush
examples: brush the dust from the jacket

results.definition: rub with a brush, or as if with a brush
examples: Johnson brushed the hairs from his jacket
